prompts.seedanceVideo: Create a child-safe educational lesson video for subject "Exam Prep" and lesson "A-Level Standards and Targets". Target audience: pre-K through grade 12 adaptable, inclusive global classroom representation. Visual style: bright pastel palette (red, yellow, blue, green, white), high readability, soft rounded shapes. Structure: 3 acts (hook, explained concept, recap) with simple visual storytelling and no on-screen brand logos. Camera: gentle motion, medium framing, occasional close-ups on key concept visuals. Duration: 35-55 seconds. Aspect: 16:9. FPS: 24. Safety constraints: no violence, no fear-based scenes, no stereotypes, no copyrighted characters. Accessibility constraints: high contrast objects, slower transitions, clean backgrounds, low visual clutter. Core concept focus: A-Level Standards and Targets. End frame: celebratory but calm transition inviting learner to continue to quiz/activity.
prompts.seedanceAnimation: Generate a short concept animation for "Exam Prep" lesson "A-Level Standards and Targets". Length: 8-12 seconds, seamless loop. Palette: happy pastels only, no dark backgrounds. Motion design: one concept transforms step-by-step using arrows/highlights and soft easing. No text overlays required; visual metaphor must be understandable for young learners. Include one mascot-neutral guiding shape to direct attention. Output: classroom-safe, no logos, no copyrighted references, no sensitive content.
prompts.lessonImage: Create a child-friendly educational illustration. Subject: Exam Prep. Lesson: A-Level Standards and Targets. Style: clean 2D digital illustration, soft shapes, high readability, low clutter. Composition: one central concept visual + two supporting details + neutral background. No text overlays, no logos, no copyrighted characters, no sensitive content. Aspect ratio: 3:2.
prompts.researchAgent: You are an education research and instructional design agent with web access. Create a production-ready lesson material brief for module "A-Level Prep Foundations" (a-level-prep-101), lesson "A-Level Standards and Targets" (a-level-prep-101-l01). Subject: Exam Prep. Target age range: 15-19. Lesson type: video. Deliver: 1) standards-aligned objectives (US and one international framework), 2) key misconceptions + remediation strategy, 3) a 40-minute lesson flow with timing, 4) 10 quiz questions with answer key and distractor rationale, 5) teacher facilitation notes, 6) accessibility and multilingual adaptation notes, 7) 3 media storyboard ideas (video, animation, image) tailored for this lesson. Use current sources and cite references with links.

Visual style: bright pastel palette (red, yellow, blue, green, white), high readability, soft rounded shapes. Structure: 3 acts (hook, explained concept, recap) with simple visual storytelling and no on-screen brand logos. Camera: gentle motion, medium framing, occasional close-ups on key concept visuals. Duration: 35-55 seconds. Aspect: 16:9. FPS: 24. Safety constraints: no violence, no fear-based scenes, no stereotypes, no copyrighted characters. Accessibility constraints: high contrast objects, slower transitions, clean backgrounds, low visual clutter. Core concept focus: Lab Safety Simulation. End frame: celebratory but calm transition inviting learner to continue to quiz/activity.
prompts.seedanceAnimation: Generate a short concept animation for "Chemistry" lesson "Lab Safety Simulation". Length: 8-12 seconds, seamless loop. Palette: happy pastels only, no dark backgrounds. Motion design: one concept transforms step-by-step using arrows/highlights and soft easing. No text overlays required; visual metaphor must be understandable for young learners. Include one mascot-neutral guiding shape to direct attention. Output: classroom-safe, no logos, no copyrighted references, no sensitive content.
prompts.lessonImage: Create a child-friendly educational illustration. Subject: Chemistry. Lesson: Lab Safety Simulation. Style: clean 2D digital illustration, soft shapes, high readability, low clutter. Composition: one central concept visual + two supporting details + neutral background. No text overlays, no logos, no copyrighted characters, no sensitive content. Aspect ratio: 3:2.
prompts.researchAgent: You are an education research and instructional design agent with web access. Create a production-ready lesson material brief for module "Chemistry Essentials" (chemistry-101), lesson "Lab Safety Simulation" (chemistry-101-l08). Subject: Chemistry. Target age range: 7-18. Lesson type: interactive. Deliver: 1) standards-aligned objectives (US and one international framework), 2) key misconceptions + remediation strategy, 3) a 40-minute lesson flow with timing, 4) 10 quiz questions with answer key and distractor rationale, 5) teacher facilitation notes, 6) accessibility and multilingual adaptation notes, 7) 3 media storyboard ideas (video, animation, image) tailored for this lesson. Use current sources and cite references with links.

Visual style: bright pastel palette (red, yellow, blue, green, white), high readability, soft rounded shapes. Structure: 3 acts (hook, explained concept, recap) with simple visual storytelling and no on-screen brand logos. Camera: gentle motion, medium framing, occasional close-ups on key concept visuals. Duration: 35-55 seconds. Aspect: 16:9. FPS: 24. Safety constraints: no violence, no fear-based scenes, no stereotypes, no copyrighted characters. Accessibility constraints: high contrast objects, slower transitions, clean backgrounds, low visual clutter. Core concept focus: Variables and Controls. End frame: celebratory but calm transition inviting learner to continue to quiz/activity.
prompts.seedanceAnimation: Generate a short concept animation for "Science" lesson "Variables and Controls". Length: 8-12 seconds, seamless loop. Palette: happy pastels only, no dark backgrounds. Motion design: one concept transforms step-by-step using arrows/highlights and soft easing. No text overlays required; visual metaphor must be understandable for young learners. Include one mascot-neutral guiding shape to direct attention. Output: classroom-safe, no logos, no copyrighted references, no sensitive content.
prompts.lessonImage: Create a child-friendly educational illustration. Subject: Science. Lesson: Variables and Controls. Style: clean 2D digital illustration, soft shapes, high readability, low clutter. Composition: one central concept visual + two supporting details + neutral background. No text overlays, no logos, no copyrighted characters, no sensitive content. Aspect ratio: 3:2.
prompts.researchAgent: You are an education research and instructional design agent with web access. Create a production-ready lesson material brief for module "General Science Explorer" (general-science-101), lesson "Variables and Controls" (general-science-101-l04). Subject: Science. Target age range: 7-18. Lesson type: video. Deliver: 1) standards-aligned objectives (US and one international framework), 2) key misconceptions + remediation strategy, 3) a 40-minute lesson flow with timing, 4) 10 quiz questions with answer key and distractor rationale, 5) teacher facilitation notes, 6) accessibility and multilingual adaptation notes, 7) 3 media storyboard ideas (video, animation, image) tailored for this lesson. Use current sources and cite references with links.
